intro: Seseli intricatum, commonly known as the intricate seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. Native to regions of central and southern Europe, it thrives in dry, rocky soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its structure and appearance make it a distinctive and often overlooked member of the carrot family.
